New Records: South Africa set a new record with six sixes hit in one ODI World Cup edition.
Quinton de Kock became the first player to hit 500 runs in a single World Cup.
Glenn Phillips scored the fastest 60 off 50 balls in the match.
Key Match Events: Marco Jansen took 11 wickets in the first 10 overs of powerplay.
South Africa's batting order scored 357/4, their highest score in the tournament.
New Zealand struggled with injuries and dropped catches, leading to their defeat.
Pre-Game Insights: South Africa chose to bat first after winning the toss.
New Zealand had several injury concerns, including Matt Henry and Jimmy Neesham.
South Africa's strong performance was inspired by their recent rugby World Cup win.
Post-Match Reflections: Quinton de Kock praised the pitch conditions and South Africa's batting performance.
New Zealand's coach Tom Latham acknowledged the team's struggles and injuries.
The match win boosted South Africa's confidence ahead of the World Cup.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played in Pune, India.
South Africa's victory moved them to the top of the points table.
Others: Live updates and timeline events throughout the match.
